body: `pnpm tauri add process@2.0.0-rc.0` works. But the default command is still expected to successfully install the latest or smth.
This should be fixed in the next release, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/pull/10795
https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/pull/10795 doesn't work for npm at least.

issue.title: [bug] Unable to install plugins via npm

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hi, I can't install plugins by instructions of documentation from:

https://v2.tauri.app/plugin/store/

or 

https://v2.tauri.app/plugin/dialog/

when I do  ` pnpm tauri add dialog` I got error 

```
> infinitytwin@0.1.0 tauri C:\Work\freetime\InfinityTwinMobile
> tauri "add" "dialog"

    Info Installing Cargo dependency "tauri-plugin-dialog"...
    Updating crates.io index
      Adding tauri-plugin-dialog v2.0.0-rc to dependencies.
    Info Installing NPM dependency "@tauri-apps/plugin-dialog@^2.0.0-rc"...
â€‰ERR_PNPM_NO_MATCHING_VERSIONâ€‰ No matching version found for @tauri-apps/plugin-dialog@2.0.0-rc

This error happened while installing a direct dependency of C:\Work\freetime\InfinityTwinMobile

The latest release of @tauri-apps/plugin-dialog is "2.0.0-rc.1".
```

But after this command Cargo dependency is added and O cam add plugin by:

`npm i @tauri-apps/plugin-dialog`






### Reproduction

Steps are provided above...

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
In tauri info there is some bulshit, I'm on Windows 11, not 10 and "cargo tauri info" is not working "no such command: `info`".

    âœ” WebView2: 128.0.2739.79
    âœ” MSVC: Visual Studio Enterprise 2019
    âœ” rustc: 1.76.0 (07dca489a 2024-02-04)
    âœ” cargo: 1.76.0 (c84b36747 2024-01-18)
    âœ” rustup: 1.26.0 (5af9b9484 2023-04-05)
    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (default)
    - node: 16.14.2
    - pnpm: 8.15.6
    - yarn: 1.22.19
    - npm: 8.5.0

[-] Packages
    - tauri ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.11
    - tauri-build ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.10
    - wry ðŸ¦€: 0.43.1
    - tao ðŸ¦€: 0.30.0
    - @tauri-apps/api îœ˜: 2.0.0-rc.4
    - @tauri-apps/cli îœ˜: 2.0.0-rc.13

[-] Plugins
    - tauri-plugin-shell ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.3
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-shell îœ˜: 2.0.0-rc.1
    - tauri-plugin-store ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.3
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-store îœ˜: 2.0.0-rc.1
    - tauri-plugin-fs ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.4
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-fs îœ˜: not installed!
    - tauri-plugin-dialog ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.6
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-dialog îœ˜: not installed!

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - frontendDist: ../build
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: React
    - bundler: Vite
```

body:
What's the problematic `npm` and `pnpm` versions did you test with? 

I ran `npm add "@tauri-apps/plugin-http@^2.0.0-rc"` with npm and pnpm and both worked fine

I actually can confirm that the latest version of cli works fine. I forgot that cli is a cargo package and not npm. So updating cargo (`cargo update`) in `/src-tauri`, and then attempting to add plugins works now.

@amrbashir 
> What's the problematic npm and pnpm versions did you test with?

Latest pnpm (9.10) and whatever comes with lts node for npm (10.8.2). Latest tauri cli rc (rc.16).

`pnpm tauri add sql`:
```
...
      Adding wry v0.43.1 (latest: v0.44.0)
    Info Installing NPM dependency "@tauri-apps/plugin-sql@^2.0.0-rc"...
â€‰ERR_PNPM_NO_MATCHING_VERSIONâ€‰ No matching version found for @tauri-apps/plugin-sql@2.0.0-rc

This error happened while installing a direct dependency of A:\fabianlars\temp\add

The latest release of @tauri-apps/plugin-sql is "2.0.0-rc.1".

If you need the full list of all 17 published versions run "$ pnpm view @tauri-apps/plugin-sql versions".
Progress: resolved 5, reused 5, downloaded 0, added 0
Failed to install NPM dependency
    Error Failed to install NPM dependency
â€‰ELIFECYCLEâ€‰ Command failed with exit code 1.
```
^ same for `sql@2.0.0-rc` and `sql@^2.0.0-rc` btw - same for the process plugin mentioned above.

`npm run tauri add sql`:
```
...
      Adding wry v0.43.1 (latest: v0.44.0)
    Info Installing NPM dependency "@tauri-apps/plugin-sql@^2.0.0-rc"...
npm error code ETARGET
npm error notarget No matching version found for @tauri-apps/plugin-sql@2.0.0-rc.
npm error notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
npm error notarget a package version that doesn't exist.
npm error A complete log of this run can be found in: A:\_packages\npm\_logs\2024-09-18T10_17_55_748Z-debug-0.log
Failed to install NPM dependency
    Error Failed to install NPM dependency
```

----

I also had similar reports on discord so if i am using the command wrong, i'm not the only one at least.

----

Edit: Just got a new report so i'll re-open this until properly investigated.

issue.title: fix(cli/add): use `>=` for npm and `~` for other package managers

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
closes #10906

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update example for `App::show`
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/README.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->

body:
I'm using tauri-cli 2.0.0 with pnpm 9.12.0 and this still doesn't work. I get this:

![tauri-v2-pnpm-dep-install-issue](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/62aa753a-4423-4cf9-811a-6364e42ccafe)

Should this be a different issue?

Maybe the problem is related to using pnpm in the project? I can add dependencies without issues manually with pnpm, but tauri CLI doesn't seem to be able to.

Nvm, my problem was my usage of pnpm workspaces and also installing dependencies in workspace root (which is my tauri app). If I tried manually adding that with:
```
pnpm add @tauri-apps/plugin-dialog@~2
```
I got:

> â€‰ERR_PNPM_ADDING_TO_ROOTâ€‰ Running this command will add the dependency to the workspace root, which might not be what you want - if you really meant it, make it explicit by running this command again with the -w flag (or --workspace-root). If you don't want to see this warning anymore, you may set the ignore-workspace-root-check setting to true.

I was able to get this working just by adding `ignore-workspace-root-check = true` into my `.npmrc`
However it would be nice if Tauri CLI would show the pnpm error message so this would have been faster to figure out.
try with `--verbose` flag, it should show the error
